intro: Erigeron purpuripes, commonly known as the purplestem fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It features slender, erect stems with grayish-green foliage and produces showy purple to pinkish flower heads. Erigeron purpuripes is often found in arid environments and is adapted to thrive in low-nutrient soils.
